title: Ukraine, E3 to start Geneva talks; Rubio rejects Russia ‘wish list’ claim
summary: Stakeholders are gathering to start negotiations based on a text that the EU believes mostly favours Russian demands.

title: Verstappen wins Las Vegas F1 GP while Norris extends championship lead
summary: Lando Norris closes in on first Formula One Drivers' championship after finishing second to Max Verstappen in Nevada.

title: Northern Australia assesses damage after Tropical Cyclone Fina
summary: Thousands have lost power due to Fina, which also caused property damage, but resulted in no injuries to residents.

title: Death toll from Vietnam floods rises to 90, several still missing
summary: Vietnamese government estimates economic losses of $343m across five provinces due to the floods.

title: Accused, shunned, exiled: The women banished to Ghana’s ‘witch camps’
summary: Women accused of witchcraft are cast out of their communities in north Ghana. Now some are trying to break this cycle.

title: Israel has violated Gaza truce nearly 500 times in 44 days, killed hundreds
summary: Gaza Government Media Office says Israel fully responsible for humanitarian, security repercussions from its violations.

title: Russia-Ukraine war live: US, European officials to discuss Trump’s plan
summary: Officials from the US, Ukraine, and national security advisers from France, UK and Germany to hold talks.

title: ‘Enough repression’: Thousands of Tunisians protest against Kais Saied
summary: Protesters in Tunis denounce an escalating crackdown on dissent and demand the release of jailed dissidents.

title: Airlines cancel Venezuela flights amid US warning, military buildup
summary: Flight suspensions come after US regulator warned planes of security risk in the airspace in and around Venezuela.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,368
summary: Here are the key events from day 1,368 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: Is the global public tuning out the climate change debate?
summary: Divisions mark the last days of the UN climate summit in the Brazilian city of Belem.

title: Air traffic suspended at Netherlands airport after drone sightings
summary: Drone sightings caused suspension of air traffic at Eindhoven airport, impacting both civilian and military operations.

title: Au Sud-Liban, une étude révèle le "danger persistant" des frappes israéliennes au phosphore blanc
summary: En cartographiant 248 frappes, une enquête menée par un chercheur en sources ouvertes, Ahmad Baydoun, met en lumière l’utilisation par Israël du phosphore blanc lors du dernier conflit au Sud-Liban, entre octobre 2023 et novembre 2024, dont les effets sur la santé, l’agriculture et l’environnement restent particulièrement préoccupants.

title: Des frappes font 21 morts à Gaza, Israël dit avoir tué cinq cadres du Hamas
summary: La trêve a encore été fragilisée, samedi, dans la bande de Gaza où des frappes israéliennes ont fait au moins 21 morts, selon la Défense civile locale. Israël a affirmé de son côté riposter à une attaque du Hamas et avoir tué cinq cadres du mouvement islamiste palestinien.

title: Sahara occidental, Moyen-Orient... Comment le tracé des frontières joue un rôle dans les conflits
summary: De l’Afrique à l’Asie, du Sahara occidental à Kaliningrad, de simples tracés sur une carte ont parfois propulsé des peuples dans des univers contrariés. Entretien avec Jean-Baptiste Veber, qui nous explique comment les cartes ont généré des tensions géopolitiques et dessiné le monde contemporain.

title: Syrie : premiers procès des massacres intercommunautaires s'ouvrent à Alep
summary: En Syrie, le premier procès des massacres intercommunautaires de mars dernier s'est ouvert à Alep. Un procès qui se veut très symbolique, en s'inscrivant dans le cadre du processus de justice transitionnelle. Il s'agit du premier procès publiquement accessible depuis la chute de Bachar al-Assad.

title: Crash d'avion à Dubaï : une démonstration aérienne vire au cauchemar
summary: Un avion de chasse indien s'est écrasé vendredi lors d'une démonstration aérienne au salon aéronautique de Dubaï aux Emirats arabes unis, tuant son pilote.

title: En Cisjordanie occupée, 30 000 déplacés palestiniens face à une "crise de santé mentale"
summary: Dix mois après l'opération "Mur de fer" menée par Israël en Cisjordanie occupée, plus de 30 000 personnes de trois camps de réfugiés restent déplacées et multiplient les appels à l’aide. Ce déplacement prolongé a dégénéré en une grave "crise sanitaire" avec notamment des conséquences psychologiques estime un coordinateur de l'ONG Médecins sans frontières.

title: L'UE promet une enveloppe de 88 millions d'euros en faveur de l'Autorité palestinienne
summary: Quelque soixante délégations rassemblant les 27, les pays arabes et plusieurs organisations internationales se sont retrouvés jeudi à Bruxelles. À cette occasion, l'UE a annoncé un chèque de 88 millions d'euros pour soutenir l'Autorité palestinienne, dont le rôle reste incertain dans la bande de Gaza dévastée par la guerre menée par Israël contre le Hamas.

title: Nouh Zaiter, l'un des plus puissants trafiquants de drogue du Liban, arrêté par l'armée
summary: Le principal baron de la drogue du Liban et trafiquant d'armes, Nouh Zaïter, a été arrêté jeudi par l'armée libanaise lors d'une opération dans l'est du pays.

title: Une “célébration du massacre 7 octobre” organisée en Syrie : ce que l'on sait
summary: Le ministère israélien des Affaires étrangères accuse la Syrie d’avoir organisé une "fête nationale" en hommage au 7-Octobre. Mais l’événement en question, programmé localement à Alep, n’aurait pas été approuvé par le ministère syrien de la Culture et aurait été annulé quelques heures après son annonce.

title: Après une journée meurtrière à Gaza, Israël et le Hamas s'accusent de violer la trêve
summary: Au moins 27 personnes ont péri mercredi dans des frappes israéliennes sur la bande de Gaza, l'un des bilans les plus lourds depuis l'entrée en vigueur de la trêve le 10 octobre. Israël et le Hamas se rejettent la faute.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu se rend sur le plateau du Golan syrien et provoque la colère de Damas
summary: Le Premier ministre israélien, Benjamin Netanyahu, s'est rendu, mercredi, auprès des troupes déployées en Syrie, de l'autre côté de la ligne de démarcation entre les deux pays toujours en guerre. De son côté, Damas a dénoncé une "violation" de sa souveraineté, accusant Israël d'empiéter sur une zone tampon censée séparer les forces des deux États.

title: Liban : l'armée israélienne annonce des frappes contre le Hezbollah
summary: Après avoir émis des ordres d'évacuation, Israël a frappé, mercredi après-midi, le sud du Liban, selon l'armée, qui affirme avoir visé des sites militaires du Hezbollah.

title: Donald Trump estime que les démocrates auteurs d’un appel à la désobéissance des militaires « devraient être en prison »
summary: Le président américain a réagi à une vidéo de six élus démocrates, publiée mardi, signalant aux militaires et aux agents du renseignement qu’ils pouvaient refuser les « ordres illégaux ».

title: Les jumelages franco-palestiniens se réinventent face à la guerre et aux blocages
summary: De Trappes à Lyon, de nombreuses collectivités françaises créent ou renforcent leurs partenariats avec des villes et camps palestiniens. Des liens mis à l’épreuve par les restrictions israéliennes en place et les controverses politiques.

title: Au Vietnam, les inondations ont fait au moins 90 morts en une semaine
summary: La majorité des victimes ont été recensées dans la province montagneuse de Dak Lak, dans le centre du pays.

title: Les îles Salomon toujours menacées par les bombes de la bataille de Guadalcanal
summary: L’offensive majeure des Alliés durant la seconde guerre mondiale s’est terminée en février 1943. Mais aujourd’hui encore, les engins non explosés constituent une épée de Damoclès pour les habitants de l’archipel, faute de déminage d’ampleur.

title: Quand une écrivaine syrienne se fait la porte-parole des survivants de Gaza
summary: « Une mémoire de l’anéantissement », le dernier ouvrage de Samar Yazbek, rassemble une saisissante série de témoignages de rescapés de l’enfer de Gaza.

title: Formule 1 : Max Verstappen s’impose à Las Vegas, Lando Norris se rapproche du titre mondial
summary: Il reste encore deux courses cette saison, au Qatar et à Abou Dhabi. Sauf rebondissement, Lando Norris devrait terminer en tête du classement général.

title: François Hollande : « Le plan de Trump réduit l’Europe au rang de spectatrice assiégée »
summary: L’ancien chef de l’Etat estime, dans un entretien au « Monde », que « pour Trump, notre continent est fini, il n’est plus dans le jeu », et que si Zelensky « tombe, c’est notre sécurité qui est entamée. Et, un jour ou l’autre, c’est nous aussi qui chuterons ».

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : Marco Rubio et Steve Witkoff, l’émissaire diplomatique de Donald Trump, seront dimanche à Genève pour discuter du plan de Trump
summary: Une réunion des pays de la coalition des volontaires doit aussi se tenir mardi en visioconférence.

title: Flagorneries et humiliations, Donald Trump met la diplomatie européenne à l’épreuve
summary: Entre provocations, mépris des institutions multilatérales et pragmatisme mercantile, le président des Etats-Unis bouleverse les codes. Pour préserver un lien transatlantique jugé indispensable, l’Europe s’adapte à ses exigences imprévisibles, au risque de céder à la servilité.

title: Filippo Sorcinelli, gay et fier comme un couturier du pape
summary: L’Italien est l’un des tailleurs préférés du Vatican. A 49 ans, il a habillé les trois derniers papes, dont Léon XIV, qui débutera le 27 novembre son premier voyage apostolique. Catholique et homosexuel, ce joueur d’orgue observe avec patience et indulgence la lente évolution de l’Eglise.

title: Au Royaume-Uni, la désespérante réalité de la pauvreté infantile
summary: Un tiers des enfants britanniques vivent sous le seuil de pauvreté dans des familles devenues tributaires de la charité publique. En cause : l’inflation tenace et les sévères limitations aux allocations, que le gouvernement Starmer envisage de déplafonner dans son budget 2026.

title: A Gaza, le sauvetage in extremis d’artefacts millénaires, une lutte pour l’histoire
summary: Au milieu des pertes humaines et matérielles colossales engendrées par la guerre, une poignée de passionnés se battent pour la sauvegarde de trésors archéologiques : le 10 septembre, ils obtenaient de l’armée israélienne un répit de quelques heures avant le bombardement d’un dépôt d’artefacts. Un déménagement hautement sensible, fruit de négociations acharnées.

title: Thousands in Israel protest to demand judicial inquiry into 7 October events
summary:
Thousands in Israel protest to demand judicial inquiry into 7 October events

Thousands of protesters demonstrated in Tel Aviv’s Habima Square on Saturday to demand a state commission of inquiry into the events of 7 October 2023.

Times of Israel reported that the protesters demanded a state commission, which would be led by the judiciary, less than a week after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government voted to launch its own self-mandated inquiry.

title: Israeli army carries out large-scale demolition operation in Khan Younis
summary:
Israeli army carries out large-scale demolition operation in Khan Younis

The Israeli army on Saturday carried out a large-scale demolition operation inside the yellow line southeast of Khan Younis city, Al Jazeera reported. 

Earlier in the day, Israeli forces carried out 10 air strikes on Khan Younis inside the yellow line. 

The yellow line in Gaza demarcates the area in which Israeli troops can remain according to the ceasefire plan. It is an operational boundary imposed by the Israeli military, which has, since the US brokered ceasefire came into effect last month, turned into a restricted-movement zone. 

Al Jazeera reported that the Israeli military also blew up buildings east of Gaza City.

title: Fresh Israeli raid in West Bank spark clashes, one Palestinian detained
summary:
Fresh Israeli raid in West Bank spark clashes, one Palestinian detained

Israeli forces on Saturday raided the town of Beit Rima, northwest of Ramallah, in the occupied West Bank, Wafa news agency reported. 

The report said that the forces detained a Palestinian man during the raid, after which confrontations broke out in the area. 

Israeli troops also stormed the nearby village of Deir Ghassaneh, sparking more confrontations without reports of casualties.

title: Israel carries out ten air strikes in Khan Younis, artillery targets Rafah
summary:
Israel carries out ten air strikes in Khan Younis, artillery targets Rafah

Israeli forces on Saturday carried out 10 air strikes on Khan Younis inside the yellow line, while artillery shelling targeted the eastern part of Rafah city in the southern Gaza Strip.

The yellow line in Gaza demarcates the area in which Israeli troops can remain according to the ceasefire plan. It is an operational boundary imposed by the Israeli military, which has, since the US brokered ceasefire came into effect last month, turned into a restricted-movement zone. 

Al Jazeera reported that the Israeli military also blew up buildings east of Gaza City. 

A total of 497 violations have been recorded since the US-brokered agreement came into force six weeks ago, with nearly 350 Palestinians killed, the report said.

title: Lebanese officials condemn Israel for killing town council member
summary:
Lebanese officials condemn Israel for killing town council member

Lebanese municipalities on Saturday condemned the killing of Yassine Hussein by the Israeli military, calling it a criminal act. 

Hussein was a member of the town council in the border village of Hula and was targeted by an Israeli air strike in the Bint Jbeil district earlier today. 

“We condemn this criminal act that will only add to the perseverance and persistence of our people,” the town of Rab Thalathin said in a statement.

title: Protesters in Stockholm rally against renewed Israeli attacks on Gaza
summary:
Protesters in Stockholm rally against renewed Israeli attacks on Gaza

Demonstrators gathered in the Swedish capital on Saturday to protest Israeli attacks on Gaza, despite the ceasefire agreement in place, Anadolu news agency reported.

Protestors gathered in Odenplan Square in central Stockholm said that Israel is violating the ceasefire agreement and continues to block humanitarian aid into the besieged Palestinian enclave.

Dror Feiler, a Jewish activist attending the rally, said: “Palestinians are being killed every day in Gaza, while ethnic cleansing continues in the occupied West Bank.”  

“Our governments continue to buy and sell weapons. They continue to support Israel politically and diplomatically ... that’s unacceptable,” Feiler added.

title: Settler attack in central West Bank wounds six Palestinians
summary:
Settler attack in central West Bank wounds six Palestinians

Israeli settlers attacked Palestinians in the town of Beit Ur al-Tahta in the central West Bank, Al Jazeera Arabic reported. 

The report said that at least six Palestinians were wounded in the attack.

title: Israeli soldiers shoot Palestinian worker near Bethlehem
summary:
Israeli soldiers shoot Palestinian worker near Bethlehem

Israeli forces on Saturday opened fire on a Palestinian worker east of Bethlehem, news agency Wafa reported.

The agency said that occupation soldiers opened fire in the Wadi al-Hummus area east of Bethlehem, wounding a man, after which he was transferred to the hospital.

title: Video: Israeli strikes kill more than 22 in Gaza on Saturday
summary:
Video: Israeli strikes kill more than 22 in Gaza on Saturday

Sources in Gaza hospitals reported that at least 22 Palestinians, including children, were killed in various Israeli air strikes in the Gaza Strip.

A civilian car and four homes were among the targets of the military.

Sources in Gaza hospitals reported that at least 22 Palestinians, including children, were killed in various Israeli air strikes in the Gaza Strip.

A civilian car and four homes were among the targets of the military. pic.twitter.com/R6SX81Jaks

— Middle East Eye (@MiddleEastEye) November 22, 2025

title: Israeli settlers use toxic substance to poison sheep in West Bank
summary:
Israeli settlers use toxic substance to poison sheep in West Bank

Israeli settlers on Saturday poisoned a flock of sheep in the village of al-Mughayyir in the occupied West Bank, Palestinian media reported. 

The reports said that a toxic substance was thrown into the grazing area, after which dead sheep belonging to a local Palestinian shepherd were found at the site. 

Israeli newspaper Haaretz reported that Israeli troops were present in the area and left shortly before signs of poisoning were discovered.

The development comes amid reports of other attacks on farmers by Israeli settlers in the area.

The UN reported at least 260 settler attacks in the West Bank in October.

title: Hamas: No truth to claims we declared Gaza ceasefire over, Israel violating truce
summary:
Hamas: No truth to claims we declared Gaza ceasefire over, Israel violating truce

A senior member of the Hamas political bureau, Ezzat al-Risheq, on Saturday said that media reports saying the Palestinian group announced the Gaza ceasefire “is over” are false. 

“There is no truth to what the Israeli sources published regarding Hamas informing [Steve] Witkoff that the agreement has ended. We have called on the mediators and the US administration to intervene and compel Israel to implement the agreement,” Risheq told Quds News Network. 

The comments after Saudi state-owned Al Arabiya quoted unnamed sources saying Hamas said “the agreement is over” and “Gaza will not become another Lebanon”. 

“Israel is fabricating pretexts to evade the agreement and return to the war of annihilation, while it is the one violating the agreement daily and systematically,” he said. 

The Palestinian health ministry reported that 318 people have been killed in Israeli aggression since the truce came into effect last month.

title: Two Palestinians wounded by Israeli gunfire in West Bank, Wafa reports
summary:
Two Palestinians wounded by Israeli gunfire in West Bank, Wafa reports

Two Palestinians were wounded by Israeli gunfire in the city of Qalqilya in the occupied West Bank, news agency Wafa reported on Saturday.

Israeli forces stormed the city and raided the Kafr Saba neighbourhood, and fired live ammunition and toxic gas bombs, resulting in two citizens being shot, the report said. 

The two men were hit in their lower limbs and transferred to a hospital, it added.

title: Tehran calls IAEA Board resolution ‘a stain on its sponsors’
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Ministry spokesperson Esmaeil Baqaei has condemned the recent anti-Iran resolution adopted by the International Atomic Energy Agency’s Board of Governors, calling its content “a stain on the designers and sponsors of it.”

title: Hamas dismisses allegations of ceding truce deal, says Israel fabricates pretexts to continue war
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Hamas, the Palestinian resistance movement that governs Gaza, has rejected claims that it backed out of a ceasefire deal with Israel, saying the regime is inventing pretexts to undermine the agreement.

title: Official: Elit forest fire under control
summary: Chalous, IRNA – Head of the Iranian Crisis Management Organization Hossein Sajedi said the fire in Elit forest in the northern province of Mazandaran is now under control.

title: Second night of Fatimiyya mourning held with Leader’s presence
summary: The second night of ceremonies marking the martyrdom of Hazrat Fatemeh Zahra (SA) was held on Saturday evening (November 22, 2025) at the Imam Khomeini Hussainiya, attended by Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei and thousands of people of various strata.

title: Iran committed to pursue nuclear progress vigorously: Lawmaker
summary: Shiraz, IRNA – Head of the National Security and Foreign Policy Commission of Iran’s Parliament Ebrahim Azizi has reaffirmed the country’s determination to pursue its nuclear advancements strongly.

title: Iran’s Ambassador to China Meets with Foreign Minister Araghchi
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Abdolreza Rahmani Fazli, the Ambassador of the Islamic Republic of Iran to China, has met on Saturday with Abbas Araghchi, Iran’s Minister of Foreign Affairs.

summary: Tehran, IRNA – Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei has observed the Fatemiyeh mourning ceremony for a second night in a row on Saturday evening at Imam Khomeini's Husseiniyeh.

title: Hamas urges ceasefire mediators to intervene as Israel kills dozens more in Gaza
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The Palestinian resistance group Hamas has once again urged ceasefire mediators, including the United States, to intervene amid the continued deadly Israeli strikes in violation of the truce deal.

title: Iraq’s elections thwarted hostile plots: Velayati
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Ali Akbar Velayati, a senior adviser to the Leader of the Islamic Revolution, says the high turnout and political engagement seen in Iraq’s recent election marked an unprecedented achievement that reflected the country’s growing political maturity and helped neutralize attempts by hostile actors to undermine the process.

summary: Manchester City visit Newcastle aiming to move within one point of Premier League leaders Arsenal. Full match preview, verified lineups, team news and key stats from St James’s Park.

summary: Tehran, IRNA – Minister of Information and Communications Technology Sattar Hashemi and the Head of the Communications Service under the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan, Isfandiyor Saadullo, have discussed bilateral cooperation in the fields of communications and cybersecurity.

title: UN rights expert says structural failures undermine global crisis response
summary: Tehran, IRNA – A senior United Nations human rights official says the scale of destruction in Gaza amounts to genocide, adding that the UN is hampered by deep structural failures that have weakened its ability to respond to global crises.

title: Iran, Russia seriously pursuing nuclear cooperation: Spox.
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 23 (MNA) – The spokesman of Iran's Ministry of Foreign Affairs says that Tehran and Moscow are seriously pursuing cooperation on peaceful nuclear energy.

title: Nothing would remain of Israel if war lasted two more weeks
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 23 (MNA) – The Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps (IRGC)’s spokesman said that if the recent war had lasted just two more weeks, nothing would have remained of the Israeli regime.

title: Iraq’s National Wisdom Movement official meets Iran FM
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 23 (MNA) – The Deputy head of Iraq’s National Wisdom Movement held a meeting with Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi in Tehran.

title: Airlines cancel Venezuela flights amid US warnings
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 23 (MNA) – Six international airlines have suspended flights to Venezuela after the United States warned major carriers about a “potentially hazardous situation” due to “heightened military activity” around the South American country.

title: Leader attends Second night of Fatemieh mourning ceremony
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 23 (MNA) – The Leader of the Islamic Revolution, Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei, attended the second night of the mourning ceremony of Hazrat Fatemeh Zahra (SA) on Saturday evening.

title: Israeli strikes kill at least 23 in Gaza
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 23 (MNA) – At least 23 Palestinians were killed in Israel’s air raids on the Gaza Strip on Saturday.

summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 23 (MNA) – Lady Fatima al-Zahra, the daughter of Prophet Muhammad, is remembered for her exceptional piety, compassion, and unwavering strength, qualities that have made her a symbol of moral integrity and spiritual devotion.

summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 23 (MNA) – Here are the front pages of Iran's English language dailies on Sunday, November 23.

summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 23 (MNA) – The United States is going to start a new phase of applying pressure on Venezuela to overthrow the government of President Nicolas Maduro.

summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 22 (MNA) – Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatollah Khamenei observed the Fatemiyeh mourning ceremony for a second night in a row on Saturday evening at Imam Khomeini's Husseiniyeh.

title: EU to convene to discuss Trump’s 28-point plan for Ukraine
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 22 (MNA) – European Council President António Costa has convened a special meeting of all 27 EU leaders on Ukraine for 24 November on the sidelines of the EU-African Union Summit in Luanda, Angola.

title: Velayati lauds Iraq people for unprecedented turnout to polls
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 22 (MNA) – Ali Akbar Velayati has praised the people of Iraq for their turnout to the polling stations in the recent parliamentary elections, saying that the turnout showed that those people have gained political maturity.

title: دانشگاه علوم پزشکی به تعهدات خود برای تجهیز درمانگاه هشتبندی عمل کند
summary: بندرعباس - رئیس شورای اسلامی شهر هشت‌بندی از نگاه تبعیض آمیز دانشگاه علوم پزشکی هرمزگان در توسعه امکانات بهداشتی و درمانی در شرق و غرب هرمزگان انتقاد کرد.

title: داداشی: جو خراسان شمالی تا چهارشنبه پایدار خواهد ماند
summary: بجنورد- مدیرکل هواشناسی خراسان شمالی گفت: پدیده غالب وزش باد و غبار صبحگاهی است و آسمان در اکثر ساعات صاف خواهد بود.

title: وقتی محبت به حضرت علی، وحدت‌آفرین می‌شود
summary: غدیر می‌تواند و باید مایه‌ی اتحاد مسلمانان باشد؛ همان‌گونه که رهبر معظم انقلاب نیز بر آن تأکید فرموده‌اند.

title: حسین تربته به مدال برنز رسید
summary: حسین تربته به مدال برنز بازیهای المپیک ناشنوایان توکیو دست یافت.

title: بازگشت پیکر فرزند شهید زوجی ۹۰ ساله به داراب فارس
summary: داراب- بعد از ۴۱ سال چشم‌انتظاری، هویت شهید ماشالله استخری فرزند زوجی ۹۰ ساله شناسایی و پیکر مطهر این شهید والامقام در سالروز شهادت حضرت زهرا(س) در داراب فارس تشییع خواهد شد.

title: بازار ۱۹ هزار میلیاردی آنتی‌بیوتیک‌ها در ایران
summary: مدیرکل دفتر نظارت و پایش محصولات سلامت محور سازمان غذا و دارو، از سهم 19 هزار میلیارد تومانی آنتی بیوتیک ها در بازار دارویی کشور خبر داد.
